result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
8:50 AM Defendant Mitchell E. McConley in court.  Attorney Jacquelyn Wolter in court for Mitchell E. McConley.  Attorney Margaret Anne Kunisch in court for State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Preliminary Hearing filed. Court accepts waiver and binds over to Br 2; sets Arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. 1:41 PM Defendant Mitchell E. McConley appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jacob Van Kerkvoorde (not eligible) appeared by video for Mitchell E. McConley.  Prosecuting attorney Robert G. Barrington in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not have complaint. Court will recall when has copy.
1:48 PM Back on record. Appearances same. Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges, penalties and right to Preliminary Hearing. Court finds probable cause. Prelim requested, waiving time limits. Prelim & Review set. Court sets $5,000 Cash bond with conditions: Defendant shall not consume alcohol or other intoxicants.  Defendant must maintain absolute sobriety. Defendant shall not go upon the premises of any establishment whose primary business activity involves the sale or distribution of alcoholic beverages, including bars, taverns, liquor stores and beer tents. Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle without permission from this Court.
